itemDescription: British actor, theatre director, dramatic recitalist, drama teacher (1921-2007)

wikipedia_page.main: Robert Marsden ((1921-08-22)22 August 1921 – (2007-04-05)5 April 2007) was an English actor, director, dramatic recitalist and teacher of drama at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art, and elsewhere.  He was also one of the earliest (and latest surviving) wartime members of the BBC Radio Drama Repertory Company, formed to meet the circumstances of World War II.

link_mentions.page: List of Doctor Who supporting characters
response: *President Abraham Lincoln (Robert Marsden,The First Doctor, Ian Chesterton, Barbara Wright, & Vicki use the space-time visualiser to witness Abraham Lincoln delivering the Gettysburg Address in The Chase. wax sculpture)Lincoln's wax sculpture at Madame Tussauds is featured in the Third Doctor serial Spearhead From Space.

response: * The Chase, a 1965 episode of Doctor Who, played by Robert Marsden
